page.title: 07FARMING PAISLEY
page.content: In the different seasons the farmers of{Harelaw Farm} do different work. In Spring they do spring-cleaning which involves cleaning and white-washing the outhouses,for example the byre.Hay is made in July and August. The daily routine of the farmer begins when he gets up at 5.30 a.m. and has some coffee. Then he brings in the cows and milks them until around 8 a.m. Next he puts them out to graze until milking in the afternoon.He then has his breakfast after which he feeds the calves by hand.He has lunch at mid-day.In the afternoons he mucks out the byres and does the milking again. At 5.30 p.m. he has his evening meal and looks forward to the end of his day.The farm is a busy place and there is always something to take care of.
